entry.title: Movement Correction and Remote Coaching: A New Research Program
entry.content: How does the correction of fitness movements methodology transfer to remote coaching?

entry.title: Open Questions in the Accessibility of Programming with Vision Impairments
entry.content: I collect open questions of interest in the area of accessibility of programming with vision impairments. The questions are extracted from the paper: ‘Addressing Accessibility Barriers in Programming for People with Visual Impairments: A Literature Review’.

entry.title: Glanceable Visualizations on Smartwatches
entry.content: About the paper ‘Glanceable Visualizations: Studies of Data Comparison Performance on Smartwatches’.

entry.title: SODBeans: A debugger for people with vision impairments
entry.content: My notes on the paper SODBeans introducing a debugger for those with vision impairments.

entry.title: Indexed Operations
entry.content: Discusses a very useful combinator that combines folds and maps.

entry.content: I’m actively recruiting a PhD student for Fall 2021. Read more for the details.

entry.title: Universal Properties
entry.content: A note on universal properties and the Yoneda lemma. Updates: Added example showing representability for adjoint functors.

entry.title: From monads to comonads and back

entry.title: A brief history of graded modalities
entry.content: I give a brief introduction to the history around graded modalities (graded (co)monads). Updated 2021-01-29: added Wadler:2003, Petricek:2013, and Petricek:2014.

entry.title: Category Theory Notes
entry.content: A place for me to actively write about category theory. I’ll be writing these here on my blog rather than thinking about finished products. This makes sharing my notes eaiser, and is more fun. You are already able to follow along if you are intereted, because I’ll post updates to my RSS feed.

entry.title: New Blog Infrastructure
entry.content: This post introduces Metatheorem’s new blog infrastructure using Pandoc, GNU Make, and a new tool called Panfeed.
